Specific Details: Sought reduction in the Mental Health Waiting Lists, Implementation of the Substance Misuse Strategy Report and Increased funding for the Youth Sector.
DPOs Lobbied: Joe Carey|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Martin Conway|Senator|Seanad::Michael Harty|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Pat Breen|Minister of State|Department of Jobs, Enterprise and Innovation
Subject Matter: Sought reduction in the Mental Health Waiting Lists, Implementation of the Substance Misuse Strategy Report and Increased funding for the Youth Sector.
Intended Results: Increased understanding of issues impacting on young people.  Increased support for the Youth Sector.
Lobbying Activities: Event organised by Youth Work Ireland in Buswells Hotel on October 5th - all TD's and Senators invited to attend. Young people from the CYS Younger Voices Group attended the event accompanied by Margaret Slattery CEO of Clare Youth Service.  The Young People spoke with the TD's about the work of Clare Youth Service.  They raised a number of issues seeking the Elimination of Mental Health Waiting Lists, Implementation of the Substance Misuse Strategy Report and the Increased funding for the Youth Service.|Lobby day|1

Specific Details: A request for either the adequate resources to meet the increasing compliance requirements or a reduction in these requirements. An increase in the resources for the Youth Work Sector. Provision of security of funding to enable the Community and Voluntary sector retain skilled and qualified staff and therefore continue to deliver quality responses to identified needs.
DPOs Lobbied: Pat Breen|Minister of State|Department of Jobs, Enterprise and Innovation::Michael Harty|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Joe Carey|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Martin Conway|Senator|Seanad
Subject Matter: A request for either the adequate resources to meet the increasing compliance requirements or a reduction in these requirements. An increase in the resources for the Youth Work Sector. Provision of security of funding to enable the Community and Voluntary sector retain skilled and qualified staff and therefore continue to deliver quality responses to identified needs.
Intended Results: Greater understanding of the increased pressures on youth organisations.::Addtional Resources for the sector.::Greater understanding of the work of the sector.
Lobbying Activities: The event was organised by Youth Work Ireland as part of the celebrations for YWI Week in April.  Member Youth Services met with TD's and Senators on an individual basis in the Mansion House on April 25th. The young people from the CYS Younger Voices youth group spoke about the work of the Youth Service and the benefits they gain from involvement.  They shared the results of a recent survey they had conducted in the County and highlighted the specific concerns of young people.  They then spoke about the challenges facing the Youth Service in continuing to meet the needs of young people. Of increasing concern is the lack or absence of resources being provided to meet the growing burden of compliance and reporting.  Lack of multi-annual budgets allied with insecure funding creates real difficulties in trying to maintain effective, quality services for young people.|Lobby day|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: The Young Voices Youth Group accompanied by Margaret Slattery

Specific Details: Meeting with Minister Simon Coveney, also attended by local elected representatives, to outline current Shannon Chamber interventions with Government
DPOs Lobbied: Simon Coveney|Minister|Department of Foreign Affairs::Martin Conway|Senator|Seanad::Joe Carey|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Meeting with Minister Simon Coveney, also attended by local elected representatives, to outline current Shannon Chamber interventions with Government
Intended Results: Progress on interventions that Shannon Chamber has presented to Government namely: Changes to Border Custom Post (BCP) controls for agri-food and related products; New European PSO hub for Shannon Airport & permanent inclusion of Shannon and Cork in Regional Airports Programme; National Energy Crisis; Transition of Shannon Heritage sites to Clare County Council; URDF funding for the implementation of the new Shannon Town Centre Masterplan
Lobbying Activities: This meeting was held in the Old Ground Hotel in Ennis on 30 September 2022 and also attended by Helen Downes, CEO, Shannon Chamber, Senator Martin Conway and Joe Carey T.D.|Meeting|1

Specific Details: Email updating the Health Committee and local politicians of the ongoing failure of Beaumont Hospital to return the IKA Renal Support Centre upon the expiry of the Agreement between both parties, in order to ensure that the centre can be restored to its original purpose - that of providing support and accommodation to renal patients from all over the country travelling to Beaumont for treatment
DPOs Lobbied: Martin Conway|Senator|Seanad
Subject Matter: Email updating the Health Committee and local politicians of the ongoing failure of Beaumont Hospital to return the IKA Renal Support Centre upon the expiry of the Agreement between both parties, in order to ensure that the centre can be restored to its original purpose - that of providing support and accommodation to renal patients from all over the country travelling to Beaumont for treatment
Intended Results: To inform public officials of the ongoing situation with Beaumont Hospital with a view to engaging support in order to restore the Renal Support Centre to the IKA if no progress is being made in current discussions between both parties upon the expiry of the Agreement
Lobbying Activities: Email sent on 12.07.23 to update public officials on the lack of progress in having the Renal Support Centre returned to the IKA.|Email|1
